label: urgency
description: Creating a time-sensitive reason for the homeowner to act now, such as limited-time discounts, expiring incentives, or upcoming price increases.

label: Social Proof
description: Using testimonials, references, or evidence that other homeowners have trusted and benefited from your service to build confidence and credibility.

label: Price Anchoring
description: Introducing a higher price point first to make the actual offer seem more affordable by comparison, helping the homeowner perceive greater value.

label: Authority
description: Positioning the salesperson or company as a trusted expert through credentials, certifications, experience, or association with reputable brands or media.

label: Scarcity
description: Creating perceived limitation of availability—such as limited install slots, popular products running out, or high demand—to increase desire and prompt faster decisions.
